alert.note: Alert for Deuel; Keith; Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 7:04PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Keith, northwestern Lincoln and southeastern Deuel Counties through 745 PM CDT/645 PM MDT/... At 703 PM CDT/603 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brule, or 7 miles east of Big Springs, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ogallala, Big Springs, Paxton, Brule, Sarben, Keystone, Roscoe, Kingsley Dam, Nevens, Megeath, Broganville, Lake View Campground, Big Bald Hill and Goldeneye State Wildlife Management Area. This includes the following highways... Highway 61 between mile markers 80 and 99. Highway 92 near mile marker 138. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 103 and 155. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Lake McConaughy, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
